messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

I don't have direct access to your location data when you're asking questions through this interface. To help determine what city you're in, I can use a tool to look up a location if you provide me with your current latitude and longitude coordinates.

Do you know your current latitude and longitude? If so, I can search to find what city that corresponds to.
I don't know my latitude and longitude.

In that case, I won't be able to determine your city using my tools, as the location search requires specific latitude and longitude coordinates.

For finding your city without GPS coordinates, you might consider:

- Checking your smartphone's "Location" or "Maps" app
- Looking for nearby landmarks, road signs, or business addresses
- Asking someone locally who might know
- Checking local weather apps or news that often display location

I'm afraid my available tools are limited to searching when given exact coordinates, so I can't auto-detect or calculate your location from the conversation.
Alright, maybe I'll try checking on my phone maps later. Thanks for the info.
You're welcome! Your phone's maps app will definitely give you the city name quickly. Hope you figure out your location soon, and feel free to come back if you have other questions I can help with!
